colabseg.new_gui_functions module#

class ColabSegData#

Bases: object

Docstring for ColabSegData data structure framework.

Methods

analyze_protein_membrane_min_distance([...])

analyze distance between particle positions and a membrane segmentation

backup_step_to_previous()

takes the current value and overwrites the previous step

calculate_normals([cluster_indices, fit_indices])

Calculate the normals of each voxel based on nearest neighbors uses a plane fit (very basic method)

compile_xyz_string(point_cloud)

Compiles an xyz file string for viz in py3DMol

convert_tomo([step_size])

optimized version of conversion code

crop_fit_around_membrane([cluster_index_tv, ...])

use kdtree for distance calculation

dbscan_clustering([cluster_index, ...])

DBSCAN subclustering of the individual clusters after processing If the clusters are all numbered the same

delete the positions from the gui

Uses the covaiance based edge detection to remove points from the point cloud.

Extract a slice from the original tomogram and visualize

get_selected_sphere_radii([fit_indices])

return a list of sphere radii based on a selection

interpolate_membrane_rbf([cluster_index, ...])

Interpolate extended membrane using scipy RBF fit.

interpolate_membrane_sphere([cluster_index])

Least square fit for a perfect sphere and adding of points.

read all class variables from hdf5 file format and populate instance

Load an stl file.

load_tomogram with pyto library

Merge two or more clusters by vstacking them

Fits plane through extracted point cloud and rotates the positions

Trim lamina at top and bottom

eigenvalue_outlier_removal(cluster_index, k_n=300, thresh=0.05)#

Uses the covaiance based edge detection to remove points from the point cloud. Code adpated from: denabazazian/Edge_Extraction

extract_slice(filename, slice='center')#

Extract a slice from the original tomogram and visualize

flip_normals()#
get_lamina_rotation_matrix(alignment_axis='z')#
get_selected_sphere_radii(fit_indices=[])#

return a list of sphere radii based on a selection

interpolate_membrane_rbf(cluster_index=0, skip_to_downsample='auto', functiontype='linear', smooth=5, directionality='xz')#

Interpolate extended membrane using scipy RBF fit.

interpolate_membrane_sphere(cluster_index=0)#

Least square fit for a perfect sphere and adding of points. For vesicles and spherical viruses.

load_hdf(filename)#

read all class variables from hdf5 file format and populate instance

load_point_cloud(filename)#

Load a plain point cloud from a txt file. In case a user has some preprocessed input on hand

load_protein_position(filename)#

Load a protein position list (XYZ file)

load_stl_file(filename)#

Load an stl file. This is a common output from IMOD as a mesh. For sake of consistency only the positions are loaded.

load_tomogram(filename)#

load_tomogram with pyto library

merge_clusters(cluster_indices=[])#

Merge two or more clusters by vstacking them

Trim lamina at top and bottom
